Author: crumb#2550
Content: all wallets share the same blockchain data. you don't have to re-download for OceanQT if you have already downloaded and synced with Verus Agama

Author: crumb#2550
Content: you can think of different wallets as just GUI skins

Author: crumb#2550
Content: all the relevant data is not associated with ANY wallet

Author: crumb#2550
Content: it's the blockchain, y'know

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: my guess nSPV will be available for any KMD asset and same as coins wanting dPOW they could employ nSPV ?

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: Was there actually any issue with SPV confirmations already? longer response time or sth ?

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: or we have current problems solved, so now is time to solve the future ? :pirate:

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all headers need to be synced with SPV clients, with equihash that is 2kb per block -> 2GB for million blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it does require dPoW for the chain

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So a project has to be onboarded on dpow in order to qualify for nspv?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: and has to have a kmd eco coin assigned to it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: needs to be dPoW and runtime fork

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: It's a cool idea but if we have had a hard time onboarding projects to dpow at a constant rate, we can expect the same for nspv.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: If a project is faced with the question of creating an app around nSPV or SPV, they will likely choose SPV since it's standarized and more widely used.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that assumes that nSPV doesnt increase the adoption rate

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: does nSPV create any revenue for KMD?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it also wont work for external coins, even with dPoW, unless they make source level changes to support nSPV

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nSPV solves the massive scalability of userbase problem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if other projects dont want to solve it, we cant force them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: SPV takes a long time to sync headers and requires local storage of them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nSPV allows for basically instant startup and gives nearly full node security

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can downplay its importance all you want, but the reality is that it solves one of the few unsolved problems remaining on the tech side

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nSPV is not meant to increase the number of external chains onboarded to dPoW

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is to enable arbitrary userbase for any ecosystem project

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So it's not meant to replace SPV in general

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as a side effect, it could create a meaningful increase in dPoW demand

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it reduces sync data from 2GB+ to 20kb to onboard a new user

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is comparing to SPV
